questions.prompt: In this question, we’re going to ask you about your projects. What project would you want to continue working on if you had to choose one?
What would you do if you continued working on this project?
In this question, we’re going to ask you about projects that you are proud of. What project are you most proud of?
What about this project makes you proud?
Here’s a list of concepts we covered this year. Choose a concept that you think is really beautiful or interesting.
Copy-paste the repo name of a project that you think showcases the beauty of this concept.
In 3 - 4 sentences, describe why you think this project shows the beauty of this concept.
Here’s a list of concepts we covered this year. Choose a concept that you still don’t totally understand.
Copy-paste the repo name of a project that uses this concept where you still don’t totally understand how the code works
In 3 - 4 sentences, what confuses you about this project?
In this question, we’re going to ask you about the documentation of your projects. Look through your projects and copy-paste the repo name of one that doesn’t have much documentation.
Choose one function that does not have a description of what it does.
What is the name of the function?
In 3 - 4 sentences, what does the function do?
What does the function return?

In this question, we’re going to ask you about the planning of your projects. Copy-paste the repo name of a project where the planning document describes something significantly different than the actual project you ended up making.
In 3 - 4 sentences, describe what caused the project to change directions and why you responded in the way you did.
In this question, we're going to ask you about the testing methods you used. Choose from the list of errors you may have seen:
In 3 - 4 sentences, describe a time that you experienced this error. Mention a specific project/repo.
Then explain what you needed to do to resolve that error.
In this question, we're going to ask you to consider and evaluate multiple solutions. Choose one of the following problems:
inputOptions: Drawing the grid from HW0.3 (Not on Github)
Designing the computer's strategy from lab-uno

questions.prompt: In 3 sentences, describe the pseudocode you used to solve the problem in your code. Imagine you're describing this to a friend in CS9 over the phone so they can understand what you did at a high-level without you repeating the code word by word.
We chose these problems because we discussed multiple solutions to the problem in class. In 3 more sentences, describe another approach you could have solved this problem.
In this question, we’re going to ask you about your projects. What is one idea from the year that seems really important that you think other people should be aware of?
In 3 - 4 sentences, why do you think this idea is so important?
In 3 - 4 sentences, describe something important that is happening in the world and is related to CS, which you think we should study next year.
